newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan buys April reformate at close to $29.00/bbl.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan buys April reformate at close to $29.00/bbl.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has bought by tender 250,000 barrels of leaded and unleaded 95-octane reformate each at close to $29.00 per barrel, industry sources said on Thursday.
CPC officials were unwilling to divulge the award prices. The cargoes are for April 1-15 delivery, on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to Taiwan.
"Out of the request of the winner, we have to keep the final price p-and-c (private and confidential) as they reduced the offer to a price more tolerable to CPC," the official said.
The official said initial offers into the tender which closed on March 4 were at $29.00 to $29.50 per barrel c-and-f Keelung, Taichung, Kaohsiung or Shalung.
A CPC official told Reuters late Wednesday it had rejected offers and was seeking to negotiate with those who made the best offers.

In its last tender, CPC bought two unleaded reformate cargoes for March 16-30 delivery at $27.90 and $28.20 per barrel on a c-and-f basis respectively from a Dutch trader and a South Korean trader, traders said.
